dialogue.raw_text: . SPAULDING And now I would like to introduce a local hero, S. Quentin Quale, a.k.a. The Butcher Boy, a.k.a. Nurse Nellie and most famously a.k.a. Dr. Satan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . SPAULDING Murderer, torturer and most of all master surgeon. Mr. Quale an intern at Willows State Mental Hospital, nicknamed Weeping Willows for its neverending cries of pain, took great pleasure in control. Through primitive brain surgery. Mr. Quale believed he could create a race of superhumans from the mentally ill, or so the story goes. His terrifying experiments continued until 1952.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . SPAULDING At which time he was discovered and turned over to authorities for observation. Unfortunately, Mr. Quale was abducted from his cell by members of the victims' families. Vigilante justice prevailed and Dr. Satan was taken out and hanged. The next day his body was found to be missing. Some say he survived, rescued by his loyal slaves, others say they hung the wrong man... To this day no sign of Dr. Satan has ever been discovered. But who knows? Maybe he lives next door to you.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room goes silent. All eyes are focused on the stairs. A robed figure, Otis, appears at the top of the stairs, he begins to descend. Rufus waits at the bottom of the stairs. As Otis reaches the last step Rufus hands him the megaphone. Denise, Mary and Jerry struggle to watch as they in turn rotate past the scene unfolding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Otis walks closer to the rotating captives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Otis stops the spinning of his prisoners and stands directly before Denise. He drops his robe, underneath he is wearing a SUIT OF SKIN sewn together from pieces of Denise's father. Denise stares in horror, tears stream down her cheeks, barely able to comprehend the madness around her. Otis moves in close and licks her across the face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone chants "Who's your Daddy?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slowly turns the chain to face Jerry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jerry's eyes widen in fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baby rolls Grampa over to Jerry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother moves in close to Jerry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Otis grabs Jerry's cheeks and makes his face move like a ventriloquist dummy, provides Jerry's voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baby grabs Mary and does the same ventriloquist routine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baby rotates Mary around to where Gramps is seated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tiny, growing restless, begins banging on his metal drum. KLANG - KLANG - KLANG. Rufus joins in, clapping his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother, Baby, Grampa join in chanting with Rufus.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . (shouting through megaphone) Show me, show me, show me, show me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Drink up, it's party time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Enjoy your last night... (looking around) ...where's Otis?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, he's coming, he got something real special this year.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . Otis, Otis, Otis, Otis!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Quiet, quiet, you know he won't come down with all this hoop-dee-doo bouncing off the walls. Now, calm down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I shot an elephant in my pajamas this morning... how he got in my pajamas I'll never know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Grampa, shhhhhhhh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then we tried to remove the tusks, but they were embedded in so firmly that we couldn't budge 'em.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gesturing at Grampa) Let him finish.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course, in Alabama the Tuscaloosa, but that's entirely irrelephant.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (through the megaphone) I'm the one who brings the Christmas candy... now tell me (pauses and raises his arms) ...Who's your Daddy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm the one who brings the devil's brandy... (waits)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who's your Daddy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes! I'm the one who beats you when you're bad...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who's your Daddy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who's your Daddy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm the one who loves you when you're fucking dead!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (imitating Willis) Now, I say my little darlings... (rotates the chain to Mary) maybe prancing around where you don't belong ain't such a winner of an idea... (slaps Mary across the face)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you, the great rusher of fools, what were you after... (slaps Jerry) Huh, speak to me... (slaps him again) Oh, that's right, Dr. Satan... everybody got to know about Dr. Satan, Jesus Christ, let the old dog rest for fuck sake, he's already got one foot in the grave and the other's tap dancing around the edge... (gets nose to nose with Jerry) ...well, I can see the disappointment on your sad little puppy face... so I'm gonna do you a favor, a big, big favor. You owe me, boy. I'm gonna let you meet the old bastard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's a horse's ass alright, I told you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Baby, roll that old love machine over here, so this boy can meet his hero.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (lifts his skin mask) You see it's all true, the boogieman is real and you found him... (Jerry stares in shock) ...why so sad? Isn't this what you begged for? There he is, the living legend himself, ta da Dr. Satan. Now, don't get shy on me... ask your hero some questions, don't blow this last in a lifetime opportunity.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Zarkoff, I will conquer the sea, the air, the earth... the universe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look at the way he lights up... Grampa just loves meeting his fans.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aw gee whiz, I'm so excited... I really think you're the coolest... you're tops on the playground, cooler than the Fonzie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, oh pick me, pick me... I have a question.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (squeezing Mary's face, hard) I was wondering Mr. Satan sir, do you like to kiss on the first date or is that considered slutty?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the fuck are you saying? Who the hell is talking to me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, my babies are getting restless.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . Dump in the pit, dump in the pit, dump in the pit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alright, alright. Cut 'em down, it's time they get what they came here for.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The rain pounds down. A heavy fog hovers over the dense growth of the field. In the distance, silhouetted by moonlight, a gruesome caravan slowly moves through the night. Otis, lantern in hand, leads the way. Followed by Baby and Mother together under a large black umbrella. Next Rufus holds the leash connected to Jerry, Denise and Mary. Bringing up the rear, Tiny, shotgun focused on the prisoners, and Grampa. Grampa is strapped to Tiny's back like a child. He waves a flashlight back and forth like a search beam. The group comes to a halt at a huge wooden structure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baby directs the light at Otis. We see that he is trying to unlock a huge padlock attached to an iron door embedded in the base of the wooden structure. Otis unlocks the door and swings it open. He reaches down into the blackness and pulls up an iron hook and wench, attached to the hook is a chain. Otis parts a section of the overgrown grass next to the pit to reveal a rusty metal crank. He begins to turn the crank. Slowly, from out of the pit, rises a coffin hanging from the end of the chain. Otis pulls the coffin over and lays it flat on the ground. He flips open the lid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rufus cuts loose Jerry, but holds him steady by the neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rufus cuts loose the gag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Otis pulls out a gun and points it at Jerry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother grabs Jerry by the collar and gives him a big kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Otis cocks the pistol. Jerry starts to slowly move towards the coffin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rufus pushes Jerry into the coffin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Denise starts kicking and fighting with Rufus. Rufus tries to hold her steady, when suddenly Mary breaks free and starts to run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baby jumps with excitement and runs off across the field after Mary. Mary trips and falls over a small gravestone. She gets up and stumbles back into a wooden cross. She tears the gag from her mouth and gasps for air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary turns toward the voice but sees nothing but wooden crosses. She is in a homemade cemetery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary turns 360 degrees, but finds nothing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (handing Baby the lantern) Hold this. Point it over here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey happy-boy, step your ass up here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take his gag out, it's more fun with the screaming.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I like the screaming too... it's so much more exciting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please don't kill us, please don't kill us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (imitating Jerry) Please don't kill us, please don't kill us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bitch, shut your mouth and get your shit in the box.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let us go, please... let the girls go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (imitating Jerry) Let us go, please... let the girls go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get in... now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait, I want to say good-bye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bye sweety, we could of been great together.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please, let us go, we won't tell anybody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aw, honey you know I can't do that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We won't tell anybody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Christ, ain't this fucking a hoot... alright mamma, I ain't got all fucking night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please, please this is insane. You can't do this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is and I can... next.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughs and raises his pistol) Where's she think she's a gonna get to? She's gonna run all the way home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No! Let me get her... (turns to Mother) ...Ma, Otis is having all the fun... can I get her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's true, Otis... not that we're having a bad time, but...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rolls his eyes) Well, go get her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) There once was a woman who lived with her daughter in a cabbage garden.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) ...along came a rabbit and ate up all the cabbages. The woman said...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) ..."Go into the garden and drive out the rabbit"...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ! Mary is hit from behind, she falls forward. Baby JUMPS on top of her and sits on her back. Baby is holding a large hunting knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary screams in pain, as Baby PLUNGES the knife into her. Baby STABS Mary again and again and again. Mary lets out a long gurgling scream, then goes silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baby, covered in blood, licks the knife clean.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: "Shoo! Shoo!" said the maiden...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ..."Come maiden," said the rabbit... (leans down) ...sit on my tail and go with me to my rabbit hutch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Otis shoves Denise into the coffin with Jerry and locks the lid shut. Through a CROSS-SHAPED OPENING in the coffin we see them crushed together. Rufus LOWERS the coffin into the pit. Once the coffin is inside Otis slams the door shut. Otis opens a small window in the door and lowers in a lantern and a small tape recorder playing music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enter Hell. The dim light of the lantern shines off the slimy wet filth of the rotted wood walls. The stench of death and decay hangs heavy in the thin air. Denise and Jerry, cold and shivering, hang half submerged in thick maggot infested sludge. Bits of animal and human skeletons float in the muck, broken bones lay in piles along the walls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the dim light, we see the tightly packed forms of Jerry and Denise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boom! A LOUD THUMP is heard against the side of the coffin.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (hysterical) We've got get out of here, we got get out of here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Think, think. Try to open the lid, try to kick a hole in the wood.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (crying) I can't... I can't move my arms. I hurt so much.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know, but we can make it out of here. We can do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That was good babe, just keep doing that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, an arm breaks through the side of the coffin. Another smashes through the top of the lid. The coffin begins to violently shake. Denise screams. Another reaches through, grabbing her feet. SMASH! The coffin is ripped apart and Jerry is pulled away from the destruction. He lets out a quick scream before disappearing into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That's not me. I didn't... I'm not doing that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Someone is out there... (shouting) ...help, we're in here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Help, help us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jerry! Jerry! Jerry!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The spastic light of TV static strobes across the sleeping face of Grampa. Beside him, Mother sleeps peacefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The rain has stopped. Tiny opens the doors to the barn. He goes inside. He exits a few moments later, dragging a huge wooden stake. He sets the stake down carefully and closes the barn doors. He then picks up the stake and drags it away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind the farmhouse is a camouflage jungle, an intricate system of ropes and netting is strung together to hide the many automobiles beneath. Rufus moves through the jungle. He stops and begins to remove the netting from a car, it is Wydell's police cruiser. He climbs inside the car, puts on Wydell's policeman's hat and starts the engine. He drives off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rufus is driving like a maniac through the open farmland. He turns on the overhead flashing lights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The police cruiser twists and turns in the barren fields.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Denise stands knee deep in the sludge. Broken bits of the coffin's remains are scattered around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A soft moaning sound is heard coming from the other end of the pit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Denise cautiously makes her way to the bend at the end of the tunnel. As she approaches, the moaning sound gets louder. She turns the corner to see:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jerry please answer me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jerry... (moving slowly forward) ...is that you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: in filthy hospital gowns hunched over a shadowy object. Denise gasps. They turn towards Denise, revealing the partially devoured dead body of Jerry. The two bone-white ghouls are dripping with Jerry's blood, they stare at Denise, then return to their prey. Denise screams in horror and runs, turning down another twist in the underground maze. She turns the corner and runs straight into SEVERAL SLOW MOVING GHOULS. The ghouls are of the same deathly white complexion, hair-less with flaked, cracking skin. Their yellow eyes shine in the darkness. They reach for her, but she breaks free and continues to run into the endless stretch of tunnels before her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Primitive wooden crosses form a circle around a burnt piece of land, approximately twenty feet in diameter. Laying flat in the center is the large stake, Mary's body is draped across it. Tiny is securing her to the stake with rope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the windshield, we see Baby jumping and dancing in the fields with several large dogs. She is firing a gun as she dances.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baby sees the car and raises her gun. She aims it at the car driver. She waits, as the car gets closer she sees the face of Rufus behind the wheel. She lowers the gun and begins to laugh. The car stops and Baby climbs into the passenger's seat. The car drives off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tiny lifts the stake with Mary firmly strapped in place. He implants it into the ground. Her body hangs like a doll. Tiny opens a gasoline can and begins splashing gas onto the stake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Otis, face painted like a SKULL and wearing a priest's robe, walks solemnly through the tall grass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Denise, waist high in sludge, wanders lost through the endless tunnels of the pit. In the distance she hears high pitched animal sounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rises up from the sludge behind Denise. It stands silent. It reaches out a BONEY HAND with long curled fingernails and grabs her hair. Denise screams and tries to pull away. The ghoul grabs her with his other hand and pulls her closer, CLAWING at her face. Denise fights her way free, but loses her footing and falls backwards, slipping under the sludge. She quickly resurfaces and starts to run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Otis stands in front of the bound Mary, holding a pumpkin. Otis places the pumpkin over Mary's head. Tiny stands behind him holding a lit torch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The police car drives wildly through the fields.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baby motions to Rufus to steer the car towards the fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beaten Denise struggles down a long tunnel. She gets to the end to find that it is a dead-end. Behind her, FIVE GHOULS move silently towards her, blocking her only exit. The ghouls slosh through the muck, moving in closer. Denise frantically looks for an escape, nailed into the wall next to her are planks of wood forming a ladder. The ghouls are only a few yards away. Denise climbs up the ladder. They move in, clawing at her legs and feet, trying to pull her down. Denise digs at the wood and mud ceiling above her, trying to break free. Denise is bleeding severely from the chunks of flesh being torn from her legs. She digs wildly at the ceiling, suddenly a board falls free and mud rains down to reveal:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the sky above shines through the hole. Denise smashes her fists at the rotted wood planks, pulling free another piece. With all her might Denise grabs hold and pulls herself up through the opening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Denise fights her way through the earth and pulls her body up into the night air. The cool air rushes to her lungs. She crawls free of the hole, gasping for air. She is safe. Suddenly... SMASH! A ghoul has broken through the surface. He grabs Denise by the leg and begins to pull her back into the hole. Denise screams and begins kicking violently at the ghoul. She breaks and crawls from the ghoul's reach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rufus and Baby have pulled the police cruiser up by the stake. Rufus and Baby stand on the hood. Otis finishes his sermon, he raises his arm. Tiny raises the torch. Otis drops his arm, signaling Tiny. Tiny throws the torch onto the stake. The stake ignites into a huge FIREBALL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Denise pulls herself to her feet and begins to run. The flaming object burns in the distance behind her. Denise stumbles toward the road on two badly injured legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rufus, Tiny and Baby jump up and down in celebration, smashing the police car. Otis stands transfixed by the flames before him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Denise makes her way out onto the road. No cars are in sight. In the distance headlights break through the darkness. Denise stands in the middle of the road. The TRUCK comes into view, it is a small cube truck. Denise stands in the headlights, waving her arms for it to stop. The truck comes to a halt. She runs toward the passenger's side door and climbs in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind the wheel of the truck is Captain Spaulding. Denise is shaking from shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Starts to turn the truck up the road back towards the farmhouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boom! The metal door leading to the back of the truck slides open. Ravelli grabs Denise and pulls her back into the back of the truck.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Go, go! Drive... drive!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . SPAULDING Hold on, girly, what's the problem?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (becoming hysterical) Murdering... blood and Jerry... (starts to cry uncontrollably) ...monsters... I... I... I got away...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . SPAULDING Well, I don't see what the fuck you're getting at, but I got some friends that live just up this road.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (screaming) No! No, that's it... that house is... (tries to open the truck door) ...I gotta get out, I gotta get out!
dialogue.name: dialogue
